perturbation.original_text: A Statement of Work may designate certain individuals as "Key Personnel" for an engagement, and the parties subsequently may agree in writing that additional individuals are Key Personnel for such engagement. If there are Key Personnel for an engagement, Contractor shall provide the Services through those personnel and such additional personnel of Contractor as Contractor may from time to time determine to be required for the performance of the Services. Company shall have the right to interview and approve such additional personnel at Company's request. If one or more Key Personnel terminate their employment with Contractor or otherwise become Page 2 of 10 unavailable to work on an engagement for reasons beyond Contractor's reasonable control, Contractor may provide the Services through other personnel with comparable training and experience. If Company becomes dissatisfied with any of Contractor's personnel providing the Services, Company may notify Contractor of the details of its dissatisfaction, and the parties shall cooperate to remedy the problem as soon as possible. If Company reasonably requests, Contractor shall reassign the individual who is the subject of Company's dissatisfaction and replace that person with other personnel in accordance with this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: A Statement of Work may designate certain individuals as "Key Personnel" for an engagement. If there are Key Personnel for an engagement, Contractor shall provide the Services through those personnel and such additional personnel of Contractor as Contractor may from time to time determine to be required for the performance of the Services. If one or more Key Personnel terminate their employment with Contractor or otherwise become Page 2 of 10 unavailable to work on an engagement for reasons beyond Contractor's reasonable control, Contractor may provide the Services through other personnel with comparable training and experience. If Company becomes dissatisfied with any of Contractor's personnel providing the Services, Company may notify Contractor of the details of its dissatisfaction, and the parties shall cooperate to remedy the problem as soon as possible. If Company reasonably requests, Contractor shall reassign the individual who is the subject of Company's dissatisfaction and replace that person with other personnel in accordance with this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'and the parties subsequently may agree in writing that additional individuals are Key Personnel for such engagement. Company shall have the right to interview and approve such additional personnel at Company's request.' we create a situation where additional Key Personnel can be added without company approval, but the document still refers to the process for reassigning dissatisfied personnel implying the company has some control over personnel assignment.

perturbation.original_text: During the term of this Agreement, Company agrees to compensate Contractor as set forth in each Statement of Work. Contractor will be compensated on a time and materials. In addition, Company shall reimburse Contractor its actual out-of-pocket expenses as reasonably incurred by Contractor in connection with its performance of the Services as negotiated in each Statement of Work.
perturbation.changed_text: During the term of this Agreement, Company agrees to compensate Contractor as set forth in each Statement of Work. Company shall reimburse Contractor its actual out-of-pocket expenses as reasonably incurred by Contractor in connection with its performance of the Services as negotiated in each Statement of Work.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'Contractor will be compensated on a time and materials.', the agreement now lacks clear guidance on the primary method of compensation. While the Statement of Work is referenced, removing the explicit 'time and materials' leaves the payment structure ambiguous. The lack of specific calculation in section 3 directly contradicts the description in section 1(a) where 'Contractor's compensation' is described as part of 'Statement of Work' details, creating uncertainty around compensation enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: Contractor represents and warrants that the Works provided hereunder, including any Contractor Information and any third party products do not infringe any trade secret, trademark, copyright, patent or other proprietary right of any other third party.
perturbation.changed_text: Contractor represents and warrants that the Works provided hereunder, including any Contractor Information do not infringe any trade secret, trademark, copyright, patent or other proprietary right of any other third party.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'and any third party products' from section 5(c), contractor's warranty doesn't cover third party product infringements. Section 1(f) states 'To the extent Contractor provides any third party materials and products Contractor acknowledges that it shall be solely responsible for ensuring the functionality and specifications of such third party materials and products used in performing Services under this Agreement.' Which contradicts that this section doesn't cover third party products. The company would assume the contractor needs to be responsible for potential 3rd party product infringements.
